item.description:
We will be doing a Bookfolders event with Generations, Inc! Bookfolders are like road maps for our older adult volunteers and the children with whom they read. They provide a library of 300-500 books for each school or after school program where we offer their programs. Every book is accompanied by a colorful bookfolder. These folders include learning material such as conversation starters, open-ended questions about the text, challenging vocabulary words and writing exercises. At bookfolder parties, volunteers will have the opportunity to put these folders together with materials that we will provide. It's a really fun service opportunity that allows volunteers to give back to the greater community and ignite their inner artist.

The event will be from 12pm to 2pm! Their office is located at 25 Kingston St in Boston on the 4th floor.  They are right next to the Downtown Crossing T Station.

This event is definitely one of my favorites, so I hope to see lots of people there :)

Please contact me with any questions. We look forward to seeing you!

-Sehily

The Boston Volunteers

Big enough to deliver, small enough to care

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


Learn more about your fellow Boston Volunteers:

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Bookfolder event: Help Children with Reading by Coloring Bookfolders!
